Democrats should NOT be the party that cuts survival checks. People need money in their pockets and we must be the party that delivers it.

If we're really the party that's #ForThePeople, then let's get it together and send these survival checks at the level we promised‚ÄîNO LESS.
4‚É£There are massive racial and ethnic disparities in all of this. ‚ÄúTargeting‚Äù further increases those disparities ‚Äî and will further increase income inequality.

3‚É£Only 24% of those who lost work have received unemployment.

Why? Because many don‚Äôt qualify. Who? Parents who stayed home for childcare. People who didn‚Äôt feel safe going to work. Young adults who didn‚Äôt have a job.

Survival checks are their only lifeline. Don't take it away.

2‚É£The data from people who filed for unemployment shows that more than 20% of those earning between $50k and $70k were still food insecure.

That's up 16% from 2019‚Äîand it's why food banks have such long lines. We need to put money in their pockets so they can feed their family.

Even if someone isn‚Äôt one of the nearly 1 million additional people losing their job EVERY single week, they likely lost hours and therefore had their overall income significantly reduced.

By ‚Äútargeting,‚Äù we cut out people who are desperately in need of help.

1‚É£The survival checks often use 2019 tax data to measure someone‚Äôs income.

Millions lost their jobs in 2020 due to COVID‚Äîthat‚Äôs the whole point of this relief!‚Äîand therefore their income from 1 or 2 years ago is no longer accurate. They need help now and we must provide it.

‚ÄúTargeting‚Äù checks isn‚Äôt just bad for people, it‚Äôs bad policy too! It‚Äôs not humane, it's not smart, it‚Äôs not effective, and it‚Äôs not even fiscally responsible. Not to mention that it doesn't meet the scale of this crisis.

If you use West Virginia cost of living #s to bring down relief for everyone, millions are left in the cold. That‚Äôs what $50k does.

Cutting checks to account for Queens/higher COL overall is a win-win. Lower COL get more bang for their buck, higher COL get their needs met.

And finally, we need to recognize that this is the job of all of us - not just those at the Capitol. We are part of a singular American story. I am working on some ideas to do just this and I hope to work with all of you. I hope that is the true legacy of Jan 6. (end)
We need to rebuild trust, understanding and accountability for our democratic institutions. We need to invest in civics and service to counteract lies and hate.
We must also work to strengthen the very institutions placed under attack. Our democracy is far too fragile if a demagog with a social media account and a megaphone can incite an insurrection.

The actions of those who perpetrated this attack - from inciting it to the death of a police officer - must be punished as to send a clear signal that violence is not an acceptable path to political change.
We must also work to strengthen the very institutions placed under attack. Our democracy is far too fragile if a demagog with a social media account and a megaphone can incite an insurrection.

The actions of those who perpetrated this attack - from inciting it to the death of a police officer - must be punished as to send a clear signal that violence is not an acceptable path to political change.
We cannot, for a moment, treat the attack of 1/6 as something normal that happened. It was a truly dark day in our nation's history and it deserves a response of that magnitude.

What we do next with that resolve is on my mind today. Do we let this moment fade, let those who brought our country to the brink of disaster be held unaccountable, or let the conditions that led to this attack go unaddressed? No.

SYMBOL OF COMMUNITY: I still see members of Congress, staff continuing to struggle with their own trauma and grief. SYMBOL OF RESILIENCE: I saw this quote over a door in the Capitol. SYMBOL OF GRATITUDE: The reminders of trauma have been met with incredible kindness and compassion. The attacks, meant to break our democratic process, have instilled a newly strengthened resolve to protect it. 100s of signs thanking Capitol Police line tunnel under the Capitol. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EtkN31lXAAMFGAc.jpg

SYMBOL OF UNCERTAINTY: I now have to pass through two layers of razor wire fencing to get to work at the Capitol. I walked the perimeter this week with the National Guard and they said they have no idea how long this protection will be necessary.
